message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.SY. 

The paper proposes a novel supervised learning method for spiking neural networks, which falls under the category of neural networks and machine learning. The paper specifically focuses on the use of the symmetric spike-timing dependent plasticity (sym-STDP) rule, which is a common topic in the subfield of computational neuroscience (cs.NE). The paper also discusses the use of visualization techniques for analyzing the performance of the model, which is relevant to the subfield of machine learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper applies the proposed method to image recognition tasks, which is a common application of machine learning and artificial intelligence (cs.AI, cs.CV). Finally, the paper discusses the potential for implementing the model on neuromorphic hardware, which is relevant to the subfield of systems and control (cs.SY).
